intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its subspecies, subsessilis, is distinguished by its shorter leaf stalks compared to the typical form. This plant is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
